author: 80raghavendra
content: Adapting pointproofs for witness compression: I posted an approach extending the contributions of "Pointproofs" paper: https://eprint.iacr.org/2020/419 with trees of vector commitments for the world state and contract storages on https://ethresear.ch/t/adapting-pointproofs-for-witness-compression/7363 (short version) and https://hackmd.io/jYZoAiK2THq50EvI6lGhMw?view (long version). Feedback invited.

author: sky.cactus
content:
Asking here since this room probably has the set of people who actually know the answer:
Is the `storageRoot` in a state trie leaf node encoded as a number or as a 32-byte array?

author: sky.cactus
content: Specifically, if the leading byte of the storageRoot is `0`, will the `storageRoot` be a 32 byte array (with a leading 0) or a 31 byte array (without a leading 0) when it is encoded/decoded?

author: Deleted User
content: as a 32-byte array. And it is pre-prepended by 1-byte RLP prefix, of course, which is 0x80+32
